info.title: Telgorithm Messaging API
info.description:
In our APIs we use a rate limit. The rate limit is the maximum number of calls you want to allow in a particular time interval.
Setting rate limits helps us to provide the best performance of integration between your software and Telgorithm by preventing other clients from affecting you.  

Despite the fact that there is no accepted standard for HTTP rate-limiting headers, we were guided by [**IETF draft: RateLimit Fields for HTTP**](https://www.ietf.org/archive/id/draft-ietf-httpapi-ratelimit-headers-05.html).  
  
We use these HTTP headers on APIs endpoints:  

```
RateLimit-Limit: containing the requests quota in the time window;
RateLimit-Remaining: containing a non-negative integer which represents the remaining requests quota in the current time window;
RateLimit-Reset: amount of seconds when the full quota will be available;
```

Default quotas:

| Endpoint                             | Default            |
| ------------------------------------ | ------------------ |
| POST `messaging/v1/OutboundMessages` | 100 per 10 seconds       |
| POST `messaging/v1/Phones`           | 120 per hour        |
| All REST GET endpoints               | 100 per 10 seconds |
| REST non-GET endpoints               | 100 per 10 seconds  |

When quota is exceeded, server do not serve the request replying instead with a 429 HTTP status code.  

If you need a bigger quota [contact us](mailto:support@telgorithm.com).

parameters.name: AreaCode
parameters.description: Filter by phone number area code. If specified, no other filters must be specified.

parameters.name: Region.Country
parameters.description:
Specifies the country to search numbers (US or CA). If omitted, US is assumed.
Note that to search by State AND City in Canada, you must specify CA explicitly. To search by State only,
it is not necessary (but still preferable) since Canadian provinces abbreviations don't intersect with US
states abbreviations.

parameters.name: Region.State
parameters.description: Two-letter abbreviation of a state in USA or a province in Canada.

parameters.name: Region.City
parameters.description:
City. Note that full city name should be specified here, otherwise the search will return nothing (i.e.
partial name search is not supported).

parameters.name: Quantity
parameters.description: Count of returned phone numbers, default is 10. Must be greater than 0 and less or equal to 100.

parameters.name: AreaCode
parameters.description: Phone number area code; one of 800, 833, 844, 855, 866, 877, 888.

parameters.name: Quantity
parameters.description: Count of returned phone numbers, default is 10. Must be greater than 0 and less or equal to 100.

features.description:
Specifies a set of features supported by the phone. This should be one of or combination of "SMS", "MMS" and "VOICE" divided by a comma.

Possible values:

  • None: None.
  • SMS
  • MMS
  • VOICE

Specifies a set of features supported by the phone. This should be one of or combination of "SMS", "MMS" and "VOICE" divided by a comma.

Possible values:

  • None: None.
  • SMS
  • MMS
  • VOICE

name.description: TCR Brand Name. Should be legal company name exactly as shown in TCR.
TCR Campaign Name. Should be exactly as shown in TCR.
TCR Campaign Name. Should be exactly as shown in TCR.

cspId.description: Campaign Service Provider Identifier in TCR (CspId).

cspIdCanBeChanged.description: If `true`, the CSP ID can be changed. Otherwise, `false`.

scope.description:
TollFree phone number (must start with country code e.g. +1...) or TCR Campaign Sid
to which end-user is opted out.

from.description: Sender of the message. Must be owned by the company.

text.description: Text of the message. Can be empty only when MediaUrls set.

priority.description:
Priority of the message. 'Normal' if not specified.

Possible values:

  • Urgent: Urgent
  • High: High
  • Normal: Normal
  • Low: Low

mediaUrls.description: Media urls of the message. If null or empty - SMS, if any - MMS.

callbackUrlOverride.description:
If specified - used for sending outbound messages events to this url.
If this url is empty then MessagingConfig urls are used for outbound messages events.
In case of failure we will send the same request to the `MessagingConfig.OutboundBackupCallbackUrl` url.
Adds 'https://' if no HTTP schema is defined.

expiresOn.description:
UTC timestamp when the message should expire. If the message is not sent before this time, its status is set to `Expired` and the message is not going to be sent anymore.
If `null`, the messages never expires and persists in the `Queued` state until it is `Sent` or `Failed`.

segmentCount.description: Number of text segments in the outbound message.

items.description: Created opt outs collection, ignoring existing opt outs.

DisplayPhoneStatus.description:
Phone Status, used in API response models.

Possible values:

  • Active: Phone number is ordered and active.
  • Pending: Phone number is ordering, but not active yet.
  • PendingPortIn: Phone number is in port-in process.
  • PendingTcrCampaignChange: Phone number is in process of changing TCR Campaign.
  • PendingMessagingConfigAdd: Phone number is ordered, but it's not associated with any MessagingConfig.
  • PendingTcrCampaignAdd: Phone number is ordered, but it's not associated with any TCR Campaign.
  • CanadianTrafficOnly: Phone number belongs to Canada and has no TCR Campaign. Only messages to Canada are allowed.
  • Removed: Phone number is Removed.

tcrBrandId.description: Brand TCR ID. Should be exactly as shown in TCR.

name.description: TCR Brand Name. Should be legal company name exactly as shown in TCR.

tcrCampaignId.description: TCR Campaign ID. Should be exactly as shown in TCR.

tcrBrandId.description: Linked TCR Brand ID. Should be exactly as shown in TCR.

name.description: TCR Campaign Name. Should be exactly as shown in TCR.

platformFees.description: Per-segment information on Telgorithm Platform fees.

passThroughFees.description: Per-segment information on Telgorithm Pass-Through fees.

MessageFeesModel.description:
Contains information on message processing fees.
There may be different platform fees per segment due to tiered pricing.

outboundCallbackUrl.description: Callback url for the outbound message events. You can find callback payload for OutboundMessageEvent at Sample Api Swagger.

outboundBackupCallbackUrl.description: Backup callback url for the outbound message events. When `OutboundCallbackUrl` is unavailable we will send the same request to this url.

inboundCallbackUrl.description: Callback url for the inbound message events. You can find callback payload for InboundMessageEvent at Sample Api Swagger.

inboundBackupCallbackUrl.description: Backup callback url for the inbound message events. When `InboundCallbackUrl` is unavailable we will send the same request to this url.

optInOutCallbackUrl.description: Callback url for the Opt In/Out messages. You can find callback payload for OptInOutEvent at Sample Api Swagger.

optInOutBackupCallbackUrl.description: Backup callback url for the Opt In/Out messages. When `OptInOutCallbackUrl` is unavailable we will send the same request to this url.

authorizationBearer.description: Authorization bearer token for the callback requests.

sendingTimes.description:
Specifies the time zone and time periods in a day when the messaging should be active.
SMS and MMS won't be sent outside of these intervals.
If `null`, the messaging is active for the whole day.

inboundCallbackUrl.description: Callback url for the inbound message events. You can find callback payload for InboundMessageEvent at Sample Api Swagger.

inboundBackupCallbackUrl.description: Backup callback url for the inbound message events. When `InboundCallbackUrl` is unavailable we will send the same request to this url.

outboundCallbackUrl.description: Callback url for the outbound message events. You can find callback payload for OutboundMessageEvent at Sample Api Swagger.

outboundBackupCallbackUrl.description: Backup callback url for the outbound message events. When `OutboundCallbackUrl` is unavailable we will send the same request to this url.

optInOutCallbackUrl.description: Callback url for the Opt In/Out messages. You can find callback payload for OptInOutEvent at Sample Api Swagger.

optInOutBackupCallbackUrl.description: Backup callback url for the Opt In/Out messages. When `OptInOutCallbackUrl` is unavailable we will send the same request to this url.

authorizationBearer.description: Authorization bearer token for the callback requests.

sendingTimes.description:
Specifies the time zone and time periods in a day when the messaging should be active.
SMS and MMS won't be sent outside of these intervals.
If `null`, the messaging is active for the whole day.

phones.description: Phones assigned to the messaging config.

inboundCallbackUrl.description: Callback url for the inbound message events. You can find callback payload for InboundMessageEvent at Sample Api Swagger.

inboundBackupCallbackUrl.description: Backup callback url for the inbound message events. When `InboundCallbackUrl` is unavailable we will send the same request to this url.

outboundCallbackUrl.description: Callback url for the outbound message events. You can find callback payload for OutboundMessageEvent at Sample Api Swagger.

authorizationBearer.description: Authorization bearer token for the callback requests.

sendingTimes.description:
Specifies the time zone and time periods in a day when the messaging should be active.
SMS and MMS won't be sent outside of these intervals.
If `null`, the messaging is active for the whole day.

scope.description:
Scope on that user is opting out.
If `scopeType` is `SenderPhoneNumber`, this field contains Toll Free or 10DLC phone number.
If `scopeType` is `TcrCampaign`, then it contains TCR Campaign Sid.

OptOutType.description:
Represents what end-user is being opted out from: sender phone number or TCR Campaign.

Possible values:

  • SenderPhoneNumber
  • TcrCampaign

errorCode.description: todo: add possible values to the doc: OutboundMessageErrorCode enum

OutboundMessageErrorCode.description:
Outbound message error code.

Possible values:

  • NoError: No error
  • SenderIsInvalid: Sender phone number is invalid
  • SenderNotInTheCompany: Sender phone number doesn't belong your company
  • SenderNotInTcrCampaign: Sender phone number doesn't belong any TCR campaign
  • SenderPhoneNotActiveYet: Sender phone number is not active yet
  • SenderPhonePendingTcrCampaignChange: Sender phone number is in process of changing TCR Campaign
  • SenderAllMNOsUnapproved: Not all MNO's were selected on currently attached TCR campaign, please re-create TCR campaign with all MNO's selected
  • RecipientIsInvalid: Recipient phone number is invalid
  • RecipientOptedOut: Message cannot be sent to the recipient because recipient has opted out
  • DestinationError: Destination number is currently unable to receive text messages (possibly no reception or handset is turned off). Check with end user
  • DestinationTxtInactive: Destination address does not have text messaging services active
  • TextIsEmpty: Text cannot be empty
  • TextIsTooLong: Text cannot be longer than 8000 characters
  • CallbackUrlIsTooLong: Callback url cannot be longer than 512 characters
  • PastExpirationTime: Expiration time which was provided with the request is in the past
  • InvalidDateFormat: UTC date-time field in the request body was provided in invalid format
  • TcrLimitIsNotEnough: Message exceeds your Campaign Registry MNO approved throughput limits. The limit specified in TCR Campaign is too low to accomodate a single message
  • BlockedAsSpam: SPAM blocking: volume/velocity policies reached and content filtering
  • Rejected: Equivalent to not authorized. Usually because the number may not have SMS enabled for example
  • DeliveryFailure: Temporarily unable to deliver. Retry
  • MessageQueueIsFull: Message queue full
  • MessageSubmittingFailed: Message submitting failed
  • UnknownPriority: Priority is wrong
  • TollFreeMsgNotSupported: Destination address does not accept messages from Toll Free Numbers
  • MsgTooLongDestProvider: Message is too long for receiving provider
  • SourceTnError: Source phone number may not be configured correctly (also possible there may be an upstream carrier outage)
  • ExternalAggregatorNetworkError: Network error between aggregator & MNO, please contact support for further details
  • DestinationBillingError: Destination number out of carrier funds for texting at the time (Possibly prepaid user). Check with end user
  • NonCompliantUrl: Message flagged due to non-compliant URL
  • TemporaryFailure: Temp TF failure likely due to maintenance update. Please retry sending again in a bit
  • TcrCampaignIsSuspended: TCR campaign, which the sender number belongs to, is suspended by MNO
  • TcrCampaignNotApprovedYet: TCR campaign, which the sender number belongs to, is not approved by DCA yet
  • TcrCampaignIsExpired: TCR campaign, which the sender number belongs to, expired
  • TcrCampaignError: TCR campaign, which the sender number belongs to, is in erroneous state. Please contact support if the problem persists
  • AccountIsSuspended: Your Telgorithm account has insufficient funds. It has been suspended
  • UnknownError: Unknown error

status.description:
Message status.

Possible values:

  • Queued: Message is queued for sending
  • Sent: Message is sent
  • Delivered: Message is sent, and the message is delivered to the recipient
  • Failed: Sending is failed, the error message is filled
  • Expired: The message has expiration time and the message couldn't be sent before this time. This may occur due to throttling if lots of outbound messages was queued previously, or during messaging config's sending time periods when messaging is not active.

errorCode.description:
If specified, denotes the error occurred when sending a message.

Possible values:

  • 0: No error
  • 1: Sender phone number is invalid
  • 2: Sender phone number doesn't belong your company
  • 3: Sender phone number doesn't belong any TCR campaign
  • 4: Sender phone number is not active yet
  • 5: Sender phone number is in process of changing TCR Campaign
  • 6: Not all MNO's were selected on currently attached TCR campaign, please re-create TCR campaign with all MNO's selected
  • 1001: Recipient phone number is invalid
  • 1002: Message cannot be sent to the recipient because recipient has opted out
  • 1003: Destination number is currently unable to receive text messages (possibly no reception or handset is turned off). Check with end user
  • 1004: Destination address does not have text messaging services active
  • 2001: Text cannot be empty
  • 2002: Text cannot be longer than 8000 characters
  • 2003: Callback url cannot be longer than 512 characters
  • 2004: Expiration time which was provided with the request is in the past
  • 2005: UTC date-time field in the request body was provided in invalid format
  • 3001: Message exceeds your Campaign Registry MNO approved throughput limits. The limit specified in TCR Campaign is too low to accomodate a single message
  • 3002: SPAM blocking: volume/velocity policies reached and content filtering
  • 3003: Equivalent to not authorized. Usually because the number may not have SMS enabled for example
  • 3004: Temporarily unable to deliver. Retry
  • 3005: Message queue full
  • 3006: Message submitting failed
  • 3007: Priority is wrong
  • 3008: Destination address does not accept messages from Toll Free Numbers
  • 3009: Message is too long for receiving provider
  • 3010: Source phone number may not be configured correctly (also possible there may be an upstream carrier outage)
  • 3011: Network error between aggregator & MNO, please contact support for further details
  • 3012: Destination number out of carrier funds for texting at the time (Possibly prepaid user). Check with end user
  • 3013: Message flagged due to non-compliant URL
  • 3014: Temp TF failure likely due to maintenance update. Please retry sending again in a bit
  • 3015: TCR campaign, which the sender number belongs to, is suspended by MNO
  • 3016: TCR campaign, which the sender number belongs to, is not approved by DCA yet
  • 3017: TCR campaign, which the sender number belongs to, expired
  • 3018: TCR campaign, which the sender number belongs to, is in erroneous state. Please contact support if the problem persists
  • 3019: Your Telgorithm account has insufficient funds. It has been suspended
  • 2147483647: Unknown error

errorDescription.description: Additional textual description of the error.

callbackUrlOverride.description:
If specified - used for sending outbound messages events to this url.
If this url is empty then MessagingConfig urls are used for outbound messages events.
In case of failure we will send the same request to the `MessagingConfig.OutboundBackupCallbackUrl` url.

mediaUrls.description: Media urls of the message. If null or empty - SMS, if any - MMS.

expiresOn.description: UTC timestamp when the message will expire (or expired).

OutboundMessageStatus.description:
Message sending status

Possible values:

  • Queued: Message is queued for sending
  • Sent: Message is sent
  • Delivered: Message is sent, and the message is delivered to the recipient
  • Failed: Sending is failed, the error message is filled
  • Expired: The message has expiration time and the message couldn't be sent before this time. This may occur due to throttling if lots of outbound messages was queued previously, or during messaging config's sending time periods when messaging is not active.

PhoneCountry.description:
Specifies country where the phone is located

Possible values:

  • US: The United States of America
  • CA: Canada

status.description:
Status of the phone.

Possible values:

  • Active: Phone number is ordered and active.
  • Pending: Phone number is ordering, but not active yet.
  • PendingPortIn: Phone number is in port-in process.
  • PendingTcrCampaignChange: Phone number is in process of changing TCR Campaign.
  • PendingMessagingConfigAdd: Phone number is ordered, but it's not associated with any MessagingConfig.
  • PendingTcrCampaignAdd: Phone number is ordered, but it's not associated with any TCR Campaign.
  • CanadianTrafficOnly: Phone number belongs to Canada and has no TCR Campaign. Only messages to Canada are allowed.
  • Removed: Phone number is Removed.

count.description: Number of segments in the group.

SegmentsGroupModel.description: Represents group of message segments billed under the same price tier.

timeZoneId.description:
Specifies the ID of the time zone which is used for time values defined in `periods`.

Possible values:

  • America/Juneau
  • America/Los_Angeles
  • America/Denver
  • America/Chicago
  • America/New_York
  • UTC-12:00
  • UTC-11:00
  • UTC-10:00
  • UTC-09:00
  • UTC-08:00
  • UTC-07:00
  • UTC-06:00
  • UTC-05:00
  • UTC-04:00
  • UTC-03:00
  • UTC-02:00
  • UTC-01:00
  • UTC+00:00
  • UTC+01:00
  • UTC+02:00
  • UTC+03:00
  • UTC+04:00
  • UTC+05:00
  • UTC+06:00
  • UTC+07:00
  • UTC+08:00
  • UTC+09:00
  • UTC+10:00
  • UTC+11:00
  • UTC+12:00
  • UTC+13:00
  • UTC+14:00

periods.description:
Specifies the set of time periods in the specified time zone when the messaging should be active.
Periods must not intersect or touch. The last period may have `to` less than `from` indicating
that the period crosses the midnight.

SendingTimesModel.description:
Specifies the time zone and time periods in a day when the messaging should be active.
SMS and MMS won't be sent outside of these intervals.

from.description:
Defines time of day in a format `hh:mm:ss`, inclusive min boundary of the period.
Must be in range from zero inclusive to 1 day exclusive.
The extent of the period cannot be less than 15 minutes or greater than
1 day.

to.description:
Defines time of day in a format `hh:mm:ss`, inclusive max boundary of the period.
Must be greater than `from` except the last period in a day - for it `to` may be less than `from`
and is interpreted as the time period crossing the midnight.
The extent of the period cannot be less than 15 minutes or greater than
1 day.

SendingTimesPeriodModel.description: Defines inclusive boundaries of one Messaging Config's sending time period.

cspId.description: CSP ID, it should be 7+ char upper alphanumeric identity prefixed with the letter 'S'.

SetCompanyCspIdRequest.description: Request to set CspId for a company.

name.description: Specifies the display name of the time zone.

timeZones.description: The list of supported time zones.

webhookSubscriptions.description: List of webhook subscriptions according to your filter query.

type.description:
Specifies the type of the webhook.

Possible values:

  • TcrCampaignImported: Notifies that new campaign was imported from TCR.
  • PhoneNumberStatusChanged: Notifies that phone number changed its status.
  • InboundCallReceived: Inbound call received.
  • InboundCallReceivedFallback: Inbound call received fallback.
  • CallStatusChanged: Call status changed.

authorizationBearer.description: Authorization bearer token for the webhook requests.
Authorization bearer token for the webhook requests.

WebhookType.description:
The list of the supported webhook types.

Possible values:

  • TcrCampaignImported: Notifies that new campaign was imported from TCR.
  • PhoneNumberStatusChanged: Notifies that phone number changed its status.
  • InboundCallReceived: Inbound call received.
  • InboundCallReceivedFallback: Inbound call received fallback.
  • CallStatusChanged: Call status changed.

webhookTypes.description: Values which can be specified for webhook type when subscribing or unsubscribing.

wasRemoved.description:
Specified whether the subscription was successfully removed or not
(i.e `true` whether the subscription existed before and `false` otherwise).

WebhookUnsubscriptionResultModel.description: Holds the result of unsubscribe operation.

basic.description: Basic Authorization header using the BASIC scheme. Use a pair `companySid:token` to access the API.
